bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Dave Leavitt, April 30, 1947

div1.p: Hench thanks Leavitt for the Reed sanitary report from Fort Robinson, Nebraska and comments on the report.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Dave Leavitt, April 30, 1947
div1.opener:
Where
is
it?
4 May 1887
Copy of original
April 30, 1947
Dr. M. D. Leavitt please
Dear Leavitt:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for presenting me with the
Sanitary Report of Walter Reed. I was delighted to have
this. I note that he must have dictated the report and
probably some Sergeant acted as his clerical assistant--
writing out the report which Doctor Reed signed. Even
though it is not all in Walter Reed's handwriting, it is
indeed an interesting item and I am very glad to have it
for my collection. I notice that he was pretty honest
and didn't gloss over the fact that his inspection showed
certain things to be in not too good shape.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alp
